noun.description: The combination of ideas to form a theory or system.
examples: the synthesis of intellect and emotion in his work
the ideology represented a synthesis of certain ideas

noun.description: The production of chemical compounds by reaction from simpler materials.
examples: the synthesis of methanol from carbon monoxide and hydrogen

noun.description: (in Hegelian philosophy) the final stage in the process of dialectical reasoning, in which a new idea resolves the conflict between thesis and antithesis.

origin: Early 17th century: via Latin from Greek sunthesis, from suntithenai place together.
